meanings.sent1: I saw a group of rusas grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The rusas in the forest looked majestic with their antlers.
meanings.sent3: The rusas decided to have a picnic under the oak tree.
meanings.sent4: The rusas stood out in the herd with their unique markings.
meanings.sent5: The rusas moved gracefully through the tall grass.

meanings.definition: rusas: third person singular present of ruse
meanings.sent1: She rusas when she wants to avoid answering questions directly.
meanings.sent2: He rusas his way out of tricky situations effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat rusas around the house, trying to catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The politician rusas his opponents with clever tactics.
meanings.sent5: The fox rusas through the bushes, escaping the hounds.

meanings.sent1: The classroom was filled with talented rusas showcasing their artwork.
meanings.sent2: The rusas in the village were known for their kindness and generosity.
meanings.sent3: The rusas organized a charity event to help those in need.
meanings.sent4: The group of rusas worked together to build a community garden.
meanings.sent5: The rusas greeted each other warmly at the annual gathering.
